pr_title: github: workflow: Fix CI failure caused by sphinx-book-theme
pr_body:
A sphinx-book-theme maintainer changed the way of getting the theme path.

Ref: https://github.com/executablebooks/sphinx-book-theme/blame/940d562fad0c8e9d4056b575c68d972ac0f9b2f4/src/sphinx_book_theme/__init__.py#L26

For jinja2>=3, it changes the way the variable is wrapped.

Ref: https://github.com/pallets/jinja/blob/5962edeb271d93687eb93f32d53ffe53f86871e0/src/jinja2/loaders.py#L184

This commit fixes the CI failure by updating jinja2 to the version that can work with sphinx-book-theme in `pip.dependencies`.

A pair of double quotes encloses the package name to prevent the shell from misrecognizing angle brackets in `setup.sh`.

Fix: https://github.com/kworkflow/kworkflow/issues/583

Signed-off-by: lookas <i@18kas.com>
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 862350625, 'comment_body': 'Why do we need `\"`? Is it because of `jinja2>=3`?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 4, 30, 12, 29, 33, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rodrigosiqueira', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 862355872, 'comment_body': "That's right. `pip install jinja2>=3` like command will make the shell exec `pip install jinja2` and put its output into a `=3` file.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 4, 30, 13, 28, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'hilookas', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 867573536, 'comment_body': 'Consider using `pip freeze -r <dependencies file>` instead of the whole `while` loop :)

```
# Get the list of uninstalled dependencies.
# `pip freeze -r <dependencies file>` compares the installed modules to the dependencies file and outputs to stderr lines like:
# "WARNING: Requirement file [pip.dependencies] contains sphinx-book-theme, but package 'sphinx-book-theme' is not installed"
# `sed` gets the module name from those lines and `paste` joins them in a single line.
pip_package_list=$(pip freeze -r $DOCUMENTATION/dependencies/pip.dependencies 2>&1 1> /dev/null | sed -r 's/^.*contains (.*),.*not installed.*$/\1/' | paste --ser
ial -d' ')
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 5, 9, 1, 21, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'tales-aparecida', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 868765459, 'comment_body': "Thanks for your advice. But for this case, we need to upgrade jinja2, because the lower version of jinja2 can't get along well with sphinx-book-theme, resulting in CI errors. The current solution checks whether the package is installed and whether its version meets the requirements. :>", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 5, 10, 2, 54, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'hilookas', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: src: explore: Add parameter amount check
pr_body:
Without checking the number of arguments can cause unexpected arguments
to be passed into the function.

The `explore_git_log` function in the `explore.sh` file will treat the
third parameter `$3` (extra parameters given by the user) as a `flag`
parameter and pass it to `cmd_manager`.

Before the commit f16c80, this would cause an error as said
in issue #409.

After the commit f16c80, the error will not occur, but the flag was
still passed with a wrong value.

This commit will output an error when the user gives the wrong amount of
parameters.

Closes #409

Signed-off-by: Haiqin Cui <i@18kas.com>

pr_title: src: build: hide error generated by make
pr_body:
When CONFIG_X86_X32 is enabled but the corresponding tool is not
installed, an error `CONFIG_X86_X32 enabled but no binutils support`
will be reported when executing `make kernelrelease`, although no error
was reported when compiling the kernel.

Since this build_info function only gets the current kernel version by
executing the `make kernelrelease` command, and this error does not
affect the getting process of the version, this commit simply hides the
error message.

Closes #398

Signed-off-by: Haiqin Cui <i@18kas.com>

pr_title: src: vm: Add dependency for vm deploy and update remote kw path
pr_body:
After commit dabb2854acfac399cc8284e32afa13e9f310a0ad, `kw_path` was deprecated.

See `update_deploy_variables` in `deploy.sh`.

This commit also adds missing dependency `libguestfs-tools` for `guestmount` and `guestfish`.

Closes #246
Closes #677

Signed-off-by: Haiqin Cui <i@18kas.com>

pr_title: documentation: Change en-dash to double dashes
pr_body:
`--force` will be rendered as `-force` (en-dash), which was confusing.

This commit checked all documentation and escape the `--` with `\--`

Signed-off-by: Haiqin Cui <i@18kas.com>

pr_title: doc: remote: Update deploy tutorial with new kw-remote
pr_body:
After the introduction of kw-remote, the deploy tutorial needs some updates.

Signed-off-by: Haiqin Cui <i@18kas.com>

This commit add `--no-reboot` option and improved the way kw combine cmd option and config file for reboot action. Cmd option will override config file for reboot action.

Docs and tests are also updated.

Closes #542

Signed-off-by: Haiqin Cui <i@18kas.com>
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 970093503, 'comment_body': 'Maybe:
Do not reboot the machine after deploy even if the reboot option is set in the config file.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 9, 13, 21, 22, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rodrigosiqueira', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 970096088, 'comment_body': 'Maybe I miss something, but I still want to read the config file to get the default behavior for the reboot option. What I expect from the `--reboot` or `--no-reboot` is that those options take high priority over the config file. For example:
* deploy.config set reboot by default
* kw deploy -> it will reboot after deploy
* kw deploy --no-reboot -> it will not reboot, even if the config file set reboot as the default behavior.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 9, 13, 21, 26, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rodrigosiqueira', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: src: remote: Accept new key from remote
pr_body:
After this commit, ssh will accept new key from remote and save the key to `known_hosts`.

Ref: https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/33271/how-to-avoid-ssh-asking-permission

Closes #610

Signed-off-by: Haiqin Cui <i@18kas.com>

This commit replaces old parser with new `kw_parse`, updates maintainers entrypoint to `maintainers_main` and updates relevant tests.

Closes #456

Signed-off-by: Haiqin Cui <i@18kas.com>

pr_title: src: explore: Add only-source only-header function
pr_body:
This commit introduces two options `--only-source` and `--only-header`.

This commit also adds a new sample header file to test this function.

Relevant documentations are also updated.

Closes #184

Signed-off-by: Haiqin Cui <i@18kas.com>

pr_title: src: setup: Add root install support
pr_body:
After this commit, setup.sh will check if it is running as root and install packages without sudo if so.

Closes #687

Signed-off-by: lookas <i@18kas.com>

pr_title: src: setup: Add root install support
pr_body:
After this commit, setup.sh will check if it is running as root and install packages without sudo if so.

Closes #687

Signed-off-by: lookas <i@18kas.com>

pr_title: src: build: Add renaming feature in `build.sh` and unify  naming of `kernel_name` in `deploy.sh`
pr_body:
After this commit, user can easily change kernel name simply adding a param after build command. Comparing to naming in deploy, naming in build process will keep consistency in grub uname etc.

Closes: #189

Some legacy variables like `mkinitcpio_name` is never used and the kernel name is called in different ways in many place such as `name`, `kernel_name` and both `name` and `kernel_name` which is confusing.

This commit unify naming of them.
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 973555781, 'comment_body': 'Here and below I simply rename it so that the same variable names mean the same thing.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 9, 17, 7, 54, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'hilookas', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 973556175, 'comment_body': "Here's a forgotten rename.

See: https://github.com/kworkflow/kworkflow/commit/dcfc948c22b0abc266a051e9d89aac81d12544a4#diff-b3809899f2b8ad53bc127a4e23f3d979b2adc0bcdb91ec01674a9a9e1cd9eeefR882", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 9, 17, 7, 58, 15, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'hilookas', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 983853705, 'comment_body': 'Remove the extra space at the end of this line.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 9, 29, 17, 43, 32, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rodrigosiqueira', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 983855435, 'comment_body': 'At the beginning of this function, add `local kernel_name`.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 9, 29, 17, 45, 37, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rodrigosiqueira', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 983856221, 'comment_body': 'Since you already change this line, please, add `${...}` around all bash variables here.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 9, 29, 17, 46, 36, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rodrigosiqueira', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 983857081, 'comment_body': 'Same as my previous comment.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 9, 29, 17, 47, 39, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rodrigosiqueira', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 983863202, 'comment_body': 'Recently, I added a new feature named `kw env`; you learn more about it at this link:

https://kworkflow.org/tutorials/kw-env.html

Anyway, you need to change this code slightly because you cannot assume that the `.config` is in the kernel path. Take a look at this draft:

```diff
diff --git a/src/build.sh b/src/build.sh
index c6fc8e2..673865c 100644
--- a/src/build.sh
+++ b/src/build.sh
@@ -134,7 +134,7 @@ function kernel_build()
   fi
 
   if [[ -n "${options_values['NAME']}" ]]; then
-    set_kernel_config_str "$flag" "CONFIG_LOCALVERSION" "${options_values['NAME']}"
+    set_kernel_config_str "$flag" "CONFIG_LOCALVERSION" "-${options_values['NAME']}" "${options_values['ENV_PATH_KBUILD_OUTPUT_FLAG']}/"
     say "CONFIG_LOCALVERSION in .config updated"
   fi
 
diff --git a/src/kwlib.sh b/src/kwlib.sh
index c60cf7c..050a613 100644
--- a/src/kwlib.sh
+++ b/src/kwlib.sh
@@ -187,7 +187,10 @@ function set_kernel_config_str()
   local flag="$1"
   local name="$2"
   local value="$3"
-  local cmd="./scripts/config --set-str $name $value"
+  local path="$4"
+  local cmd="scripts/config --set-str ${name} ${value}"
+
+  [[ -n "$path" ]] && cmd="scripts/config --file ${path}/.config --set-str ${name} ${value}"
 
   [[ "$flag" != 'TEST_MODE' ]] && flag='SILENT'
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 9, 29, 17, 53, 11, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rodrigosiqueira', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 983863634, 'comment_body': 'Where is the unit test for this function?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 9, 29, 17, 53, 32, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rodrigosiqueira', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 983867073, 'comment_body': 'Remove this echo.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 9, 29, 17, 57, 26, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rodrigosiqueira', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 984183258, 'comment_body': 'On placeholders separate words with dashes `-`.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 9, 30, 3, 45, 51, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kwy95', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 984184052, 'comment_body': 'Make the change of unifying the names on a separate commit before adding the new functionality.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 9, 30, 3, 48, 12, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kwy95', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: src: deploy: count `INSTALL` only for more accurate progress bar
pr_body:
It seems that there is STRIP in addition to INSTALL SIGN, so this commit change the way to calculate progress by counting line with INSTALL only.

Closes #692

Signed-off-by: Haiqin Cui <i@18kas.com>
